Title: array_append
Description: Appends an element to the end of an array (same as the anycompatiblearray || anycompatible operator).

Title: array_cat
Description: Concatenates two arrays (same as the anycompatiblearray || anycompatiblearray operator).

Title: array_dims
Description: Returns a text representation of the array's dimensions.

Title: array_fill
Description: Returns an array filled with copies of the given value, having dimensions of the lengths specified by the second argument. The optional third argument supplies lower-bound values for each dimension (which default to all 1).

Title: array_length
Description: Returns the length of the requested array dimension. (Produces NULL instead of 0 for empty or missing array dimensions.)

Title: array_lower
Description: Returns the lower bound of the requested array dimension.

Title: array_ndims
Description: Returns the number of dimensions of the array.

Title: array_position
Description: Returns the subscript of the first occurrence of the second argument in the array, or NULL if it's not present. If the third argument is given, the search begins at that subscript. The array must be one-dimensional. Comparisons are done using IS NOT DISTINCT FROM semantics, so it is possible to search for NULL.

Title: array_positions
Description: Returns an array of the subscripts of all occurrences of the second argument in the array given as first argument. The array must be one-dimensional. Comparisons are done using IS NOT DISTINCT FROM semantics, so it is possible to search for NULL. NULL is returned only if the array is NULL; if the value is not found in the array, an empty array is returned.

Title: array_prepend
Description: Prepends an element to the beginning of an array (same as the anycompatible || anycompatiblearray operator).

Title: array_remove
Description: Removes all elements equal to the given value from the array. The array must be one-dimensional. Comparisons are done using IS NOT DISTINCT FROM semantics, so it is possible to remove NULLs.

Title: array_replace
Description: Replaces each array element equal to the second argument with the third argument.

Title: array_sample
Feature: array_sample ( array anyarray, n integer ) → anyarray
Description: Returns an array of n items randomly selected from array. n may not exceed the length of array's first dimension. If array is multi-dimensional, an “item” is a slice having a given first subscript.

Title: array_shuffle
Description: Randomly shuffles the first dimension of the array.

Title: array_to_string
Feature: array_to_string ( array anyarray, delimiter text [, null_string text ] ) → text
Description: Converts each array element to its text representation, and concatenates those separated by the delimiter string. If null_string is given and is not NULL, then NULL array entries are represented by that string; otherwise, they are omitted. See also string_to_array.

Title: array_upper
Description: Returns the upper bound of the requested array dimension.

Title: cardinality
Description: Returns the total number of elements in the array, or 0 if the array is empty.

Title: trim_array
Feature: trim_array ( array anyarray, n integer ) → anyarray
Description: Trims an array by removing the last n elements. If the array is multidimensional, only the first dimension is trimmed.

Title: unnest
Feature: unnest ( anyarray, anyarray [, ... ] ) → setof anyelement, anyelement [, ... ]
Description: Expands multiple arrays (possibly of different data types) into a set of rows. If the arrays are not all the same length then the shorter ones are padded with NULLs. This form is only allowed in a query's FROM clause; see Section 7.2.1.4.
Examples: select * from unnest(ARRAY[1,2], ARRAY['foo','bar','baz']) as x(a,b) →
